nodebasis

Class RequestMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • nodebasis.Message
      • nodebasis.RequestMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Lifespan

    public class RequestMessage
extends Message
    The RequestMessage class extends the Message class, and is defined by the sole purpose of fetching information regarding a specific event, on the request of a node. Various complementary methods such as navigators getReturnToSender() and hasVisitedNode(Node) are provided to make it easier for a node to decide where the message is supposed to be sent thenceforth.
    Since:
    2016-05-19
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Alexander Beliaev

      RequestMessage(int addressedTo, int messageLife, int timeOfCreation, Node originatingNode)
      Creates a RequestMessage object with the id to the sought event, the amount of lives this message should possess, the time of its creation, and the origin node as a reference.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RequestMessage

        public RequestMessage(int addressedTo,
                      int messageLife,
                      int timeOfCreation,
                      Node originatingNode)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      java.lang.NullPointerException
        Creates a RequestMessage object with the id to the sought event, the amount of lives this message should possess, the time of its creation, and the origin node as a reference.

        Parameters:
        addressedTo - the id of the sought event.
        messageLife - the amount of lives the message should possess.
        timeOfCreation - the time this message is created.
        originatingNode - the Node instantiated this message.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given amount of lives are equal to or less than zero.
        java.lang.NullPointerException
        See Also:
        Message, Node

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)

        Returns true if and only if this RequestMessage and the compared object refer to the same (this == other is true), or if the both RequestMessages share the same originating Node and are addressed to the same Event.

        Overrides:
        equals in class Message
        Parameters:
        obj - the Object to compare to this.
        Returns:
        true if this RequestMessage and the compared object refer to the same, or if their values correspond.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(RequestMessage message)

        Compares this RequestMessage with another.

        Parameters:
        message - the RequestMessage to compare to this.
        Returns:
        a value >0 if this message has a greater current lifespan than the other, a value =0 if both have the same current lifespan, and <0 if the lifespan of this message is lower than the other.
